   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of the server implemented by diameter_reg.erl.
   23: %%
   24: 
   25: -module(diameter_reg_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   28: -export([run/0,
   29:          run/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([all/0,
   33:          parallel/1]).
   34: 
   35: -define(reg, diameter_reg).
   36: 
   37: %% ===========================================================================
   38: 
   39: all() ->
   40:     [parallel].
   41: 
   42: parallel(_Config) ->
   43:     run().
   44: 
   45: %% ===========================================================================
   46: 
   47: %% run/0
   48: 
   49: run() ->
   50:     run([add, add_new, remove, down, terms, pids]).
   51: 
   52: %% run/1
   53: 
   54: run(List)
   55:   when is_list(List) ->
   56:     ok = diameter:start(),
   57:     try
   58:         diameter_util:run([{[fun run/1, T], 10000} || T <- List])
   59:     after
   60:         ok = diameter:stop()
   61:     end;
   62: 
   63: run(add) ->
   64:     Ref = make_ref(),
   65:     true = ?reg:add(Ref),
   66:     true = ?reg:add(Ref),
   67:     [{Ref, Pid}] = ?reg:match(Ref),
   68:     Pid = self();
   69: 
   70: run(add_new) ->
   71:     Ref = make_ref(),
   72:     true = ?reg:add_new(Ref),
   73:     false = ?reg:add_new(Ref);
   74: 
   75: run(remove) ->
   76:     Ref = make_ref(),
   77:     true = ?reg:add_new(Ref),
   78:     true = ?reg:add_new({Ref}),
   79:     true = ?reg:remove({Ref}),
   80:     [{Ref, Pid}] = ?reg:match(Ref),
   81:     Pid = self();
   82: 
   83: run(down) ->
   84:     Ref = make_ref(),
   85:     {_, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> ?reg:add_new(Ref), timer:sleep(1000) end),
   86:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, _} -> ok end,
   87:     timer:sleep(1000),
   88:     [] = ?reg:match(Ref);
   89: 
   90: run(terms) ->
   91:     Ref = make_ref(),
   92:     true = ?reg:add_new(Ref),
   93:     [[Pid]] = [L || {T,L} <- ?reg:terms(), T == Ref],
   94:     Pid = self();
   95: 
   96: run(pids) ->
   97:     Ref = make_ref(),
   98:     true = ?reg:add_new(Ref),
   99:     %% Don't match [[Ref]] since this will only necessarily be the
  100:     %% case when the test is run in its own process.
  101:     [_|_] = [L || {P,L} <- ?reg:pids(), P == self()].
